rComments: Literally the worst professor I've had at UCSC. Very vindictive and incapable of teaching such a large class. Avoid at all costs!

Claudia is GREAT.  I see a lot of whiners in previous rating of her, but I have to say that she really cares about her students...something that a lot of UCSC students might not be used to. Get over it, she's wonderful.

Claudia is an outstanding teacher. Exceptional.   rigorous.  Astute.  Students at UCSC have gone downhill.  Pay limited or no attention to negative reviews here, they are the slackers of the west coast of California, surfers, slackers, Palin advocates, beware, get a life, get an education, take a class with Claudia, wake up, universal health care!!

i love this lady she is great i love how she says mmmmmh every 3 seconds she is tottaly knowledable about philosophy and sociology and she talks about it all the time, especially while she lectures kakakakakaka ^____^

This woman had it in for me. I did good work, I turned assignments in on time but she decided that I was her scapegoat for the quarter. Her tests and essays were easy but her criticism was very one-sided. She hadn't taught that type of class before and it showed. I just wish she had been a little less uptight.

The worst professor i have ever had, you could learn more sociology from a book, she teaches like a high school teacher, calling our students if they talked while she was talking, easy class, but to painful to sit through, all she cares about is poverty and inequality, emphasize that in your papers and you'll get an A

She was actually the least helpful professor I have ever talked to, I went in just to talk sociology and she was very defensive and antagonistic. She made me cry and she did the same thing to my friend. Please beware.
Terrible lecturer, complained about bringing computers to class. Had this really annoying hmmmm she says after everything. Easy class, incredibly boring.

The class had a lot of potential for great student discussion, but Claudia constantly interrupted people's commentary (this was particularly irritating during weekly student presentations) despite her not being educated in the subject.  Nice when talking one on one, but any amount of help was never predictable. Boring, repetitive. Worst class yet.

Grading with checks and straight lines don't mean much. Her handouts are full of spelling and grammar mistakes, and she gets you for all the grammar issues you have in your essays. Breaks are good, and class goes by slow, especially having to hear her say "mmhmm" after every sentence. Liven up a little.

for starters, some of the questions on our online quizes, midterm and final were written so horribly that they didn't make sense. Claudia made many many mistakes, which is understandable but she offfered very little flexibility to the students. certain mannerisms were very annoying, and by the end of the quarter she was just mean.

Chaufan was a controlfreak. If a student would ask her a question about a policy in class she would tell us we could read it in one of the hundred emails she sent. It's strange that a professor would be so strangely impersonal (and would want to communicate solely by email) SOC class. What happened to human interaction?

Chaufan was horrible. She was extremely unfair.I should have gotten an A,but I didn't because she wouldn't let me make up a quiz, even though I had a doctor's note. She's heartless.  She couldnot control the class, and the way she takes attendance is ridiculous.  She made us buy a 45$ clicker, and we didn't even use it!STAY AWAY

Inept. She does not know how to communicate well - mass emails read like catty remarks typed by an adolescent, and her paper prompts are incomprehensible (the TAs rewrote #2). She feigns respect for her pupils but cannot relate (no non-medically excused absences is intolerable, as is mandatory attendance in a 400-seat class). Avoid at all costs!

This class was difficult simply because she didn't know how to teach 400 students. If the students were less unruly and she was less sensitive to talking, then it would be a perfect match. Regardless of this, she made up for the difficulties with extra credit (17% of final grade!) and so as long as you do that, then you should be good in the class.

She actually was pretty helpful and clear to those of us who wanted to learn. I think the main reason the class was disorganized was the fact the class size was ridiculously large and out-of-control. Overall, I'd say the quality of her lectures was above average.

Without a doubt the worst professor I've had at UCSC. Completely incomprehensible, wastes endless amounts of class time with meaningless bs, and assumes that all of us in the intro sociology class to be bigoted retards. I couldn't say enough bad things about her, avoid at all costs!
She does not know how to teach an intro class, or a large class.  Very frustrating and unclear assignments.

she is a TERRIBLE professor. seriously, she has a hard time getting her **it together- she can't make up her mind about class rules (trying to pull off kicking people out of class for talking in a class of 400)- she let way too many people in the class and then tried to make attendence mandatory. she did not know how to teach this class at all-ARGH

I'm taking a sociology class with her right now and it's pretty much one of the most rediculous classes I have ever had- she is unclear when it comes to the content of her lectures as well as with the class rules. Overall she made it a very agitating learning experience. I no longer want to persue interest in sociology-- because of her.

Very passionate about the subject. Sometimes failed to explain things as thoroughly as they could have been. Very helpful and available to anyone who needed help. Overall a really nice person. But there's this 'Mmhmm' that she utters at the end of ever sentence; it gets annoying after a while.

She teaches like she doesn't really understand the guidelines for the class very well. She is vague about restrictions, and then hammers you after something's been turned in. She also has this annoying "mmmmm" that she utters at the end of every sentence

Claudia is made to teach Sociology of Health and Illness.  She has lots of personal experience and made the class very enjoyable throgh anecdotes and honesty.  If you take this class (or possible other Sociology classes) from her, just remember this one thing and you will be fine-  All of lifes problems are due completely to Poverty and Inequality.

It was a two day class.  Tuesdays were guest speakers. Thursdays were student presentations (for the ENTIRE quarter)! Claudia was VERY unclear about what she wanted from the assignments so it was always up in the air about what exactly you were supposed to be doing.  Grade partially based on group project and attendance.   Nice lady, bad experience

Claudia, was given the class 2 days before it started, so she did not really lecture ever. She is very willing to help anyone who wants it. I did not get a real feel for how she is as a teacher, because she was unprepared for the class.
No Comments
